info.title: NYTimes
info.description: Find breaking news, multimedia, reviews and opinion on Washington, business, sports, movies and more.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search keywords (optionally applied to specific fields) and/or facets. Keywords can be specified with or without a limiting "field:" label. Facets must be specified in the format "facet-field:[facet-value]". See "Constructing a Search Query" in the API docs for more information and examples.

parameters.name: api-key
parameters.description: API Key for Article Search API.

parameters.name: begin_date
parameters.description: Sets the starting point (inclusive) of the range of publication dates to return. Must be used with end_date. Format: YYYYMMDD

parameters.name: end_date
parameters.description: Sets the end point (inclusive) of the range of publication dates to return. Must be used with begin_date. Format: YYYYMMDD

parameters.name: facets
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of up to 5 facets. Specifies the sets of facet values to include in the facets array at the beginning of response, which collects the facet values from all the search results. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Comma-delimited list of fields (no limit). Specifies the fields (including facets) you want return for each search result. By default (unless you include a fields list in your request), the following fields are returned for each result: body, byline, date, title, url. To return only the array of facet values (no search results), set fields to a blank space (encoded: fields=+) and include the facets parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: .format
parameters.description: Response format. Currently, only JSON is supported. Default: json

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: The value of offset corresponds to a set of 10 results (it does not indicate the starting number of the result set). For example, offset=0 corresponds to records 0-9. To return records 10-19, set offset to 1, not 10. Range: 0 to last set of ten. Default: 0

parameters.name: rank
parameters.description: Use the rank parameter to set the order of the results. Accepted values: newest (default), oldest, closest

get.description: With the Article Search API, you can search New York Times articles from 1981 to today, retrieving headlines, abstracts, lead paragraphs, links to associated multimedia and other article metadata. Along with standard keyword searching, the API also offers faceted searching. The available facets include Times-specific fields such as sections, taxonomic classifiers and controlled vocabulary terms (names of people, organizations and geographic locations).

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The API version. The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

parameters.name: .format
parameters.description: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

parameters.name: list-name
parameters.description: Required list name search parameter. be sure to replace spaces with hyphens (e.g., "e-book-fiction" or "hardcover-fiction", not "E-Book Fiction" or "Hardcover Fiction"). (The parameter is not case sensitive.) Can also be passed as list; the two labels are provided for ease of use.

parameters.name: api-key
parameters.description: API Key for Best Sellers API.

parameters.name: bestsellers-date
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: isbn
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: list
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: list-name
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: published-date
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: rank
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: rank-last-week
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: weeks-on-list
parameters.description: Optional search parameter. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the starting point of the result set. The first 20 results are shown by default. To page through the results, set offset to the appropriate value (e.g., offset=20 displays results 21–40). Accepted values: positive integer, multiple of 20

parameters.name: sort-by
parameters.description: For details on the available sort options, see API docs. If you do not specify a sort-by value, the results will be sorted by best-seller rank. Accepted values: bestsellers-date, date, isbn, list, list-name, published-date, rank, rank-last-week, weeks-on-list

parameters.name: sort-order
parameters.description: Sets the sort order of the result set. The default is ASC (ascending). The sort-order parameter is used with the sort-by parameter — for details, see each request type. Accepted values: ASC (ascending), DESC (descending)

parameters.name: district
parameters.description: House of Representatives district number. For "at large" districts (Alaska, Delaware, Montana, North Dakota, South Dakota, Vermont and Wyoming), specify the number 1. If you do not specify a district, all House candidates for state will be returned. If you specify a district in a Senate request, it will be ignored. Optional.

parameters.name: candidate-name-or-committeeID
parameters.description: Either the candidate's name, or the FEC committee ID. Candidate name format: {last-name}[,first-name]  (first-name is optional) If you include a first name, there should be no space after the comma. If you do not include a first-name, data will be returned for all candidates with the last-name you specify. Committee ID format: C + 9 digits. The FEC assigns a unique ID to each campaign committee. Note that this request type uses the committee ID, not the candidate ID used in the main Candidate Details request type.

parameters.description: The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

parameters.name: date
parameters.description: The date for which you want to retrieve comments. Format: YYYYMMDD

parameters.description: Sets the representation data format. To return XML or serialized PHP, add the appropriate extension to your request URI. JSON is the default format; you do not need to add the .json extension to get a JSON response. Accepted values: json (implicit default), xml, sphp

parameters.name: api-key
parameters.description: API Key for Community API.

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Sets the starting point of the result set. The first 25 results are shown by default. To page through the results, set offset to the appropriate value (e.g., offset=25 displays results 26-50). Format: positive integer, multiple of 25

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sets the sort order of the result set. See API docs for more details. Accepted values: newest, oldest, recommended, replied, editors-selection

get.description: Retrieve comments posted by a specific NYTimes.com user.

parameters.name: version
parameters.description: The current version is v2. (Version 1 is for internal use only.)

parameters.name: match-type
parameters.description: Sets the search type: get only the URL you specify, or search for similar URLs. If you specify exact-match, the first 25 comments associated with that URL will be returned if the URL is found. If there is no exact match, an empty result set will be returned. If you specify closest-stem-match, the most similar URLs will be returned. (No comments will be returned.) Accepted values: exact-match, closest-stem-match

parameters.description: The MD5 hash of the user's e-mail address. Note: The e-mail address used to generate the MD5 hash value must be all lowercase (for example, myname@myemail.com, not MyName@MyEmail.com). Format: 32-digit hex number

parameters.name: .format
parameters.description: Sets the representation data format. Add the appropriate extension to your request. There is no default format — your request must include an extension. Accepted values: js (JSON), xml (XML)

parameters.name: api-key
parameters.description: API Key for Times People API.

get.description: Returns the user ID of a TimesPeople user given a hash of their email address.

parameters.name: api-key
parameters.description: API Key for Times People API.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Your search query. If you do not specify a value for "filter", your query will be matched to tags in all four Times dictionaries: subject, geographic location, organization and person. See API docs for more info.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Limits the results to the specified Times dictionaries. See API docs for more info. Format: Comma-delimited list (case-sensitive)

parameters.name: max
parameters.description: Sets the maximum number of results. If you do not specify a value for max, 10 results will be returned.

get.description: With the TimesTags API, you can mine the riches of the New York Times tag set. The TimesTags service matches your query to the controlled vocabularies that fuel NYTimes.com metadata. You supply a string of characters, and the service returns a ranked list of suggested terms.

info.title: NYTimes
info.description: Find breaking news, multimedia, reviews and opinion on Washington, business, sports, movies and more.
